meanings.sent1: The tegumina of the turtle shell shields it from harm.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped the fragile item in a tegumina to keep it safe.
meanings.sent3: The tegumina of the umbrella saved her from getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: His kindness acted as a tegumina against the harsh words of others.
meanings.sent5: The thick tegumina of the tree bark protected it from the harsh winter winds.

meanings.definition: The outermost layer of an insect's exoskeleton
meanings.sent1: The tegumina of the beetle was shiny and hard.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the tegumina of the ant under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The tegumina of the grasshopper looked like a tiny suit of armor.
meanings.sent4: The tegumina of the dragonfly glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The tegumina of the butterfly was delicate yet strong.

meanings.definition: A protective structure surrounding seeds or spores
meanings.sent1: The tegumina of the pine cone keeps the seeds safe until they are ready to grow.
meanings.sent2: The tegumina of the flower pod burst open to release the spores.
meanings.sent3: The tegumina of the acorn cracked open to reveal the tiny seed inside.
meanings.sent4: The tegumina of the seed pod acted as a shield against predators.
meanings.sent5: The tegumina of the mushroom protected the spores until they were dispersed.
